intro: Kennedia speciosa, commonly known as the showy kennedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. These flowers are typically 5 to 7 cm in diameter and attract a variety of pollinators, including birds and insects. Kennedia speciosa is well adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils.
